因人成事.definition: to get things done relying on others (idiom); with a little help from his friends

因人而異.definition: varying from person to person (idiom); different for each individual

因公.definition: in the course of doing one's work; on business

因公殉職.definition: to die in the course of performing one's duty (idiom)

因利乘便.definition: (idiom) to rely on the most favorable method

因勢利導.definition: to take advantage of the new situation (idiom); to make the best of new opportunities

因噎廢食.definition: lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face; to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk

因地制宜.definition: (idiom) to use methods in line with local circumstances

因孕而婚.definition: (idiom) to marry because of an unplanned pregnancy

因小失大.definition: to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)

因循.definition: to continue the same old routine; to carry on just as before; to procrastinate

因循守舊.definition: (idiom) to continue in the same old rut; diehard conservative attitudes

因愛成恨.definition: hatred caused by love (idiom); to grow to hate someone because of unrequited love for that person

因應.definition: to respond accordingly to; to adapt to; to cope with

因時制宜.definition: (idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation

因材施教.definition: (idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability

因為.definition: because; owing to; on account of

因父之名.definition: in the Name of the Father (in Christian worship)

因特網提供商.pinyin: yīn tè wǎng tí gōng shāng

因禍得福.definition: to have some good come out of a bad situation (idiom); a blessing in disguise

因私.definition: private (i.e. not work-related 因公[yin1 gong1])

因緣.definition: chance; opportunity; predestined relationship; (Buddhist) principal and secondary causes; chain of cause and effect

因而.definition: therefore; as a result; thus; and as a result, ...

因襲.definition: to follow old patterns; to imitate existing models; to continue along the same lines

因陋就簡.definition: crude but simple methods (idiom); use whatever methods you can; to do things simply and thriftily; It's not pretty but it works.
